io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.factory.impl

Class SyncTargetFactoryFromDI

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.factory.impl.SyncTargetFactoryFromDI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISyncTargetFactory

    @Singleton
public class SyncTargetFactoryFromDI
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISyncTargetFactory
    A factory to hold all synchronization target specific implementation classes as precreated instances.

    This class can be used with Java dependency injection to provide the required classes. Any dependency injection available in the implementation application is sufficient. Just add proper configuration to your DI. Nevertheless an instance does not need to be created utilizing dependency injection. It can be used as is and all necessary instances passed to the constructor.

    Example with Google's Guice

     public class SyncTargetModule extends AbstractModule {
     @Override
     protected void configure() {

         bind(ISyncTarget.class).to(MySyncTargetImplementation.class);
         bind(ISettingsProvider.class).to(MySettingsProviderImplementation.class).in(Singleton.class);
         bind(IAuthTokenProvider.class).to(MyAuthTokenProviderImplementation.class).in(Singleton.class);

         bind(ISyncFactory.class).to(SyncFactoryFromDependencyInjection.class).in(Singleton.class);
         bind(ISmintIoSynchronization.class).to(SmintIoSynchronization.class).in(Singleton.class);
     }
 }

    Example without any dependency injection

    Even without any dependency injection available, it is easy to create an instance holding all necessary pre-created instances. The instance for ISyncTarget is created by a lambda function to ensure a new instance is created all the time. 

     final ISyncFactory syncFactory = new SyncFactoryFromDI(
     new MyAuthTokenProviderImplementation(),
     new MySettingsProviderImplementation(),
     () -> new MySyncTargetImplementation()
 );

        create a new sync factory with pre-created values.

        authTokenProvider - already created and available authentication token provider
        settings - already available settings provider
        syncTargetProvider - a sync target provider

    • Method Detail

      • createSyncTarget

        public ISyncTarget createSyncTarget()
        creates an instance of the synchronization target instance.

        Since the synchronization target is a heavy class with a lot of cache data, it seems better to create a new instance on each call. However, the implementor of the sync target need to decide whether it is necessary to create a new instance on each call or not. At the moment the default implementation of ISyncJob, which is DefaultSyncJob, reuses the target for all synchronization processes as long as the job is being scheduled. As soon as the job is being rescheduled, a new synchronization target will be created.

        Specified by:
        createSyncTarget in interface ISyncTargetFactory
        Returns:
        returns a new sync target on each call.

      • getSettings

        public ISettingsModel getSettings()
        creates a settings provider to deliver the settings for the synchronization process.

        since the settings hardly change, the same provider, delivering the same settings all the time seems to be advisable.

        Specified by:
        getSettings in interface ISyncTargetFactory
        Returns:
        returns the same settings on each request.

      • getAuthTokenStorage

        public IAuthTokenStorage getAuthTokenStorage()
        creates a token storage to deliver the settings for authentication to the Smint.IO RESTful API.
        Specified by:
        getAuthTokenStorage in interface ISyncTargetFactory
        Returns:
        returns the same authentication token storage on each request.
